page.title: 12Redlynch Child Activities
page.content: Children are active in many organised activities outside school. Redlynch and Landford cub, scout, brownie and guide groups are well supported and some children ride in the New Forest.Swimming is popular both in one of two private pools available and in Salisbury Public Baths, where many awards in proficiency are achieved. In addition to recorders, children play piano, organ, violin, trombone, flute and clarinet and girls attend classes in ballet, tap and modern dancing. At present there are no Redlynch pupils in the award winning Woodfalls Band. Some children pursue handicraft activities at the Methodist Church and some are members of the local keep fit group. More than half the pupils use the Downton and/or mobile libraries.
